translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

I received Your Lordship’s letter 28, in response to mine of the 26th of last month, and regarding its content I have to tell you that I am even more convinced that Your Lordship Municipal Chamber, however in its failure everything falls upon Your Lordship Your Lordship ad hoc to preside over an electoral table; furthermore, Your Lordship Your Lordship February 10th in which Your Lordship

From the attached copy, Your Lordship will see Your Lordship Your Lordship Your Lordship

God keep Your Lordship São Lourenço, March 1, 1840. Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. Chief of Police of Boqueirão. Joaquim Francisco dos Santos Abreu.

Please proceed with all possible speed.

Letter from the President of the Primary Table of the elections of March 1st; received on the 2nd and answered the same day. Secretariat of the Presidency of the Republic

To citizen Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães, Chief of Police of Boqueirão. From the President of the Primary Table.
